"West Virginia retailers, whole- Ehlers and grocers, representing 2,000 businesses in West Virginia, are joining forces to help prevent tobacco sales to minors by sponsoring free "We Card" training seminars this week in various locations in the state. Sessions are being held through April 19.
This year's seminars will showcase a new Guide to Best Practices in preventing the sale of tobacco to minors, which includes 15 steps store owners and man- agers can take to ensure their clerks are properly checking cus- tomers' identification. The semi- nars are available free of charge to all interested participants. . The We Card program trains metall business owners, managers and employees in how to uphold . 3003 Y Bluefield, WV Bluefield Daily Telegraph APR1-0-2001
'We Card" seminar set in Bluefield
. BLUEFIELD - West Virginia retailers, grocers and whole- salers who want to prevent the sale of tobacco to minors can take a free training course today from 3 to 5 pm. at the Bluefeld Holiday Inn ..
The "We Card" seminar is sponsored by the West Virginia Coalition for Responsible Tobacco Retailing, an organiza- tion including the West Virginia Oil Marketers & Grocers Association, the West Virginia Wholesalers Association and the West Virginia Retailers Association.
This year's seminars will show- case the new Guide to Best Practices in preventing the sale of. tobacco to minors, which inchides' 15 steps store owners and managers can take to ensure their clerks are properly check- ing customer's identification. The seminars are free of charge to all interested participants.
Any retailer interested In receiving the free training should call We Card toll-free at 888-872- 4605 as soon as possible to regis- ter
The seminars feature interac- tive, skill-building sessions that teach retailers how to prevent tobacco sales to minors. Store clarks and owners will learn West Virginia's minimum-age sales laws governing tobacco products, how to spot fake L.D.s and how to-respond to difficult situations when minors attempt to buy tobacco products. In cooperation with West Virginia's retail and wholesale associations, the Coalition for Responsible Tobacco Retailing har distributed more than 6,000 "We' Card"-training and educa- tion kits. Materials include atate- specific training workbooks, video and audiocassettes, easy- .. to-read signs and other highly visible store displaya highlight- ing the minimum-age require- ment to purchase tobacco prod- ucts.
